instructions:
General Instructions

  1. The examination is of 3 hours duration.
  2. The Test consists of multiple-choice questions with different marking schemes.
  3. Each subject may have different marking schemes as indicated on the questions.
  4. For multiple choice questions: +4 for correct answer, -1 for incorrect answer.
  5. For numerical value questions: +4 for correct answer, 0 for incorrect answer.
  6. The clock will be set at the server. The countdown timer will display the remaining time to complete the exam.
  7. You cannot pause the test once started.

Navigating Through the Test

  1. To answer a question, click on one of the option buttons.
  2. To change your answer, click on another option.
  3. To clear your answer, click on 'Clear Response' button.
  4. To save your answer and move to the next question, click on 'Save & Next' button.
  5. To mark a question for review, click on 'Mark for Review' button.

Question Palette

The Question Palette displayed on the right side of screen shows the status of each question using one of the following symbols:

  • Not Visited: Question not viewed yet
  • Not Answered: Question viewed but not answered
  • Answered: Question answered
  • Marked for Review: Question marked for review

questions.subject: Physics
questions.text: A particle moves along a straight line with constant acceleration. If the velocities of the particle at time t<sub>1</sub> and t<sub>2</sub> are v<sub>1</sub> and v<sub>2</sub> respectively, then its velocity at time (t<sub>1</sub> + t<sub>2</sub>)/2 is:

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.text: Which of the following statements about hydrogen bonding is incorrect?

options.A: Hydrogen bonding is stronger than van der Waals forces
options.B: Hydrogen bonding is weaker than covalent bonding
options.C: Hydrogen bonding is responsible for the high boiling point of water
options.D: Hydrogen bonding is a type of ionic bonding

questions.subject: Physics
questions.text: Select all correct statements about the photoelectric effect:

options.A: The kinetic energy of emitted electrons depends on the intensity of incident light
options.B: The photoelectric effect occurs only for frequencies above the threshold frequency
options.C: The number of electrons emitted depends on the frequency of incident light
options.D: The photoelectric effect can be explained using the wave theory of light

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.text: Which of the following statements about colligative properties are correct?

options.A: Colligative properties depend on the nature of the solute particles
options.B: Relative lowering of vapor pressure is a colligative property
options.C: Depression in freezing point is directly proportional to molality
options.D: Colligative properties depend only on the number of solute molecules

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.text: Which of the following statements about vector spaces are true?

options.A: Every linearly independent set of vectors forms a basis
options.B: The dimension of a vector space is the number of vectors in its basis
options.C: A set of n linearly independent vectors in an n-dimensional vector space forms a basis
options.D: The union of two vector spaces is always a vector space
